===Classic line-up===
===Classic line-up===
â
[[Image:OMD - Messages single picture cover.jpg|thumb|right|Original UK 45 rpm single picture cover: ''Orchestral Manoeuvres In The Dark â Messages'']]The eponymous [[Orchestral Manoeuvres in the Dark (album)|first album]] (1980) showcased the band's live set at the time, and was basically recorded by the Humphreys/McCluskey duo, although included some guest drums from Id drummer [[Malcolm Holmes]], and saxophone from Wirral musician [[Martin Cooper (artist)|Martin Cooper]]. It had a simple, raw, poppy, melodic synthpop sound. Dindisc arranged for the song "[[Messages (OMD song)|Messages]]" to be re-recorded (produced by [[gong (band)|Gong]] bassist [[Mike Howlett]]) and released as a single (right) â this gave the band their first hit. [[Dave Hughes]] a founder member of Dalek I Love You who joined OMD in early 1980 featured in the "Messages" video.
+
The eponymous [[Orchestral Manoeuvres in the Dark (album)|first album]] (1980) showcased the band's live set at the time, and was basically recorded by the Humphreys/McCluskey duo, although included some guest drums from Id drummer [[Malcolm Holmes]], and saxophone from Wirral musician [[Martin Cooper (artist)|Martin Cooper]]. It had a simple, raw, poppy, melodic synthpop sound. Dindisc arranged for the song "[[Messages (OMD song)|Messages]]" to be re-recorded (produced by [[gong (band)|Gong]] bassist [[Mike Howlett]]) and released as a single (right) â this gave the band their first hit. [[Dave Hughes]] a founder member of Dalek I Love You who joined OMD in early 1980 featured in the "Messages" video.
A tour followed, Winston the tape recorder was augmented with live drums from [[Malcolm Holmes]], and [[Dalek I Love You]]'s Dave Hughes on synths. Hughes then left OMD in November 1980, replaced by Martin Cooper.
A tour followed, Winston the tape recorder was augmented with live drums from [[Malcolm Holmes]], and [[Dalek I Love You]]'s Dave Hughes on synths. Hughes then left OMD in November 1980, replaced by Martin Cooper.
